task.title: Configure Object Storage Gateway
task.shortdesc: This topic details how to configure OSG for either Walrus or Riak.

context.p: You must configure an object storage gateway (OSG) before it will function properly. OSGs that have been registered but not properly configured will be listed in the BROKEN state when listed with the euca-describe-services command. For example:

step.cmd: On the primary CLC, enter walrus as the storage provider using the euca-modify-property command.
Check that the OSG is enabled.

info.p: If the state appears as DISABLED or BROKEN, check the cloud-*.log files in the /var/log/eucalyptus directory. A DISABLED state generally indicates that there is a problem with your network or credentials.

substep.cmd: Enter riakcs as the storage provider using the euca-modify-property command.
Specify the RiakCS/S3 endpoint that you want to use with Eucalyptus. For example:
Provide your RiakCS credentials to access your RiakCS installation:

info.codeblock: euca-modify-property -p objectstorage.s3provider.s3accesskey=<RiakCS access key> euca-modify-property -p objectstorage.s3provider.s3secretkey=<RiakCS secret key>

step.cmd: After successful configuration, check to ensure that the state of the OSG is ENABLED by running the euca-describe-services command. For example:

info.p: If the state appears as DISABLED or BROKEN, check the cloud-*.log files in the /var/log/eucalyptus directory. A DISABLED state generally indicates that there is a problem with your network or credentials.
